bill_title: revise the number of temporary on-sale licenses that may be issued by municipalities.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the number of temporary on-sale licenses that may be issued by municipalities. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 35-4-14.2 be amended to read as follows: 35-4-14.2. There may be issued in any Any municipality one may issue an on-sale license to be operated at a convention hall established pursuant to chapter 9-52 or 9-53. Such license shall be issued without regard to the population limitations established pursuant to § 35-4-11. The number of licenses issued for the first one thousand of population or fraction thereof is two and for each additional one thousand five hundred of population of fraction thereof one additional license may be issued. However, the number of licensed issued per day may not exceed six. Any license issued pursuant to this section shall be issued for a period not to exceed five consecutive days and such the license shall expire at twelve o'clock midnight on the fifth day after issuance. No license may be issued, pursuant to the provisions of this section, in a municipality which operates a license pursuant to § 35-4-14.1. No public hearing is required for the issuance of a license pursuant to this section if the individual applying for such the license holds an on-sale alcoholic beverage license in such the municipality or holds an operating agreement for a municipal on-sale alcoholic beverage license. No person who holds an operating agreement for a municipal license pursuant to § 35-4-14.1 may receive a license pursuant to this section.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the number of temporary on-sale licenses that may be issued by municipalities. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 35-4-14.2 be amended to read as follows: 35-4-14.2. There may be issued in any Any municipality one may issue an on-sale license to be operated at a convention hall established pursuant to chapter 9-52 or 9-53. Such license shall be issued without regard to the population limitations established pursuant to § 35-4-11. In addition, any municipality with a population exceeding one hundred thousand may issue an on- sale license to be operated at a sporting event held at a publicly owned sports arena or facility that seats a minimum of one thousand persons. Any license issued pursuant to this section shall be issued for a period not to exceed five consecutive days and such the license shall expire at twelve o'clock midnight on the fifth day after issuance. No license may be issued, pursuant to the provisions of this section, in a municipality which operates a license pursuant to § 35-4-14.1. No public hearing is required for the issuance of a license pursuant to this section if the individual applying for such the license holds an on-sale alcoholic beverage license in such the municipality or holds an operating agreement for a municipal on-sale alcoholic beverage license. No person who holds an operating agreement for a municipal license pursuant to § 35-4-14.1 may receive a license pursuant to this section. BILL HISTORY 1/19/00 First read in House and referred to committee assignment waived. H.J. 140 1/20/00 Referred to Local Government. 2/3/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/3/00 Deferred to 36th legislative day, AYES 8, NAYS 4. H.J. 406 2/8/00 Local Government Reconsidered, AYES 11, NAYS 0. 2/8/00 Local Government Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 11, NAYS 0. H.J. 503
